note.p: Birth: Islingon, London, England (27 November 1857)
Death: Eastbourne, Sussex (04 March 1952)
Research Field: Neurophysiology
Education: Ipswich School (1871-1876); Caius College, Cambridge; St Thomas's Hospital, London. MB (1885, Camb); MD (1892)
Career: Lecturer on Physiology, St Thomas's Hospital, London; Professor of Physiology, University of Liverpool (1895-1913); Waynflete Professor of Physiology, University of Oxford
Honours: GBE 1922; OM 1924
Memberships: MRCS (1884); FRCP (1912)
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 1/06/1893
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1905; Copley Medal 1927; Nobel Prize (Physiology or Medicine) 1932
Lectures: Croonian 1897; Ferrier 1929
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DSB; School
